revised_title: Optimum Paired-Electron Orbitals and the Electrostatic Method in Molecular Energies
tldr: The authors develop equations to determine the optimum form of paired-electron orbitals in molecular energies. They show that for large nuclear separations, these equations become the Hartree-Fock equations for appropriate valence states of separated atoms. An electrostatic interpretation of chemical bonding is introduced using optimum paired-electron orbital functions, and numerical computations by the electrostatic method are discussed.
